intro: Lepanthes megalostele, commonly known as the giant-stemed orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, making it one of the tallest orchids in its genus. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with intricate patterns on the petals and sepals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing in the understory of rainforests. Due to its striking appearance and rarity, Lepanthes megalostele is a subject of interest for botanists and orchid enthusiasts alike.
